docs.text: robocop is an intelligent science fiction thriller and social satire , one with class and style .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film , set in old detroit in the year 1991 , stars peter weller as murphy , a lieutenant on the city's police force .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: 1991's detroit suffers from rampant crime and a police department run by a private contractor ( security concepts inc . ) whose employees ( the cops ) are threatening to strike .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to make matters worse , a savage group of cop-killers has been terrorizing the city .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: on murphy's first day of duty , after his transfer from another precinct , these cop-killers brutally murder him by shooting off his limbs one by one .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( orion pictures had to edit this extremely graphic scene in order to get an r rating from the m . p . a . a . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after the emergency room staff at the hospital cannot save murphy and declare him clinically dead , s . c . i .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: recruits his remains for their new " robocop " program .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: using the remains of murphy's body as a foundation , their scientists build a cyborg , made of both flesh and metal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the cyborg ( robocop ) is half human ( murphy ) and half robot ; the s . c . i .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: engineers have erased murphy's memory and replaced it with a computer program ( or so they think ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with his lightning quick reflexes , immense strength , and impenetrable armor , s . c . i .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: envisions robocop as an indestructible super-cop : the solution to detroit's problems .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the remainder of the plot follows robocop's crime-foiling and vengeance on his murderers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as a science fiction action-thriller , robocop is extremely effective .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dutch director paul verhoeven combines gritty action with suspense , shocking gore , and spectacular special effects .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: several sequences in the film , such as the one in which robocop employs his extremely precise aim to stop a rapist , are destined to become cult-classics .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: because robocop is so visually and emotionally rousing , it demands to be seen on a large screen with an audience--in other words , in a movie theater .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although the special effects and action are exciting , they do not by themselves set robocop apart from other films in the genre .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rather , robocop stands out for its accurate and biting satire of american society .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie makes a mockery of the star wars defense initiative , terrorism , board games , and television news broadcasts with air-headed anchors .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: these news broadcasts , which are exceptionally clever , recur periodically throughout the movie and help to provide comic relief from the intense action and gore .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the satire in robocop , however , is almost as frightening in its own way as the suspense and blood .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: 1990's america , as portrayed in the film , may seem far fetched but is in actuality ( i think ) only a slight exaggeration of the current state of american society .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the humorous satire in robocop is simultaneously credible and absurd .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: verhoeven adroitly balances the satirical comedy with the gory action to create an entertaining and enlightening piece of science fiction/social commentary .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unfortunately , robocop possesses several flaws which prevent it from qualifying as a classic within the genre .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie lacks the lasting impact of such films as the road warrior , the terminator , and aliens .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: robocop's main problem , aside from its dumb title , is that it does not sufficiently develop murphy's character .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we never learn the degree to which murphy ( as robocop ) is human and the degree to which he is a robot .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: does murphy have any human spirit or free will left , or is he merely a computer following a program ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the script halfheartedly raises these issues but then abandons them in its climactic flurry of gory action .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: moreover , it almost completely ignores the question ( and tragedy ) of denying a man his right to die in favor of turning him into a machine .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: robocop also contains several bothersome loose-ends .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as you watch robocop , you experience deja vu ; you feel as if you have seen the film before .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in many respects , robocop is reminiscent of several other films , including the terminator , return of the jedi , and even death wish .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , to its credit , robocop easily has enough originality and unique personality to avoid becoming a cheap rip-off .
docs.label: positive
